H0.text: The object that works best when reflecting light is a mirror.

H1.text: A camera works best when reflecting light.

H2.text: Binoculars are the object that works best when reflecting light.

H3.text: Eyeglasses are the object that works best when reflecting light.

A4.text: A mirror is a wave reflector. Light consists of waves, and when light waves reflect from the flat surface of a mirror, those waves retain the same degree of curvature and vergence, in an equal yet opposite direction, as the original waves.

A5.text: The reflectivity may vary with wavelength. All or a portion of the light not reflected is absorbed by the mirror, while in some cases a portion may also transmit through.
